decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and pressure the opponent. The key strategy involves playing efficient threats like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd while using cards like Quantum Riddler and Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Consign to Memory and Solitude provide additional removal and protection, allowing the deck to maintain tempo and pressure throughout the game. The mix of creatures and spells creates a versatile and adaptable strategy that can adapt to a variety of matchups.

This deck focuses on aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and pressure the opponent. By using powerful threats like Ragavan and Phelia alongside disruption like Consign to Memory and Teferi, Time Raveler, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and win quickly through combat damage. A mix of removal spells and card advantage engines help the deck maintain tempo and stay ahead in the game, while also providing flexibility in dealing with different types of threats. This deck aims to be proactive and efficient in closing out games while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and controlling the board with powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu, while locking down their options with Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact. The inclusion of Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Scion of Draco adds additional threats that can quickly end the game if left unchecked. The deck aims to maintain pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure victory.

The main idea of this Modern 1 vs 1 Combo - Hammer Time deck is to quickly assemble Puresteel Paladin with equipment like Colossus Hammer and Leyline Axe to create a powerful attacking force. Using cards like Urza's Saga and Stoneforge Mystic to tutor for key pieces, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast, explosive combos. The inclusion of cards like Shadowspear and Battlefield Improvisation helps to provide additional flexibility and resilience in a variety of matchups. By efficiently equipping creatures and generating value, the deck seeks to disrupt opponents and win the game through aggressive combat strategies.

This deck utilizes artifacts and card advantage to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and disruptive spells. By combining affinity for artifacts with aggressive creatures like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Cori-Steel Cutter, the deck can put pressure on the opponent early in the game. The inclusion of Urza's Saga provides additional value and card advantage, while cards like Metallic Rebuke and Repeal help control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence and close out the game quickly.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts to quickly build a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and removal spells. By using cards like Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble to generate mana and card advantage, along with synergies from cards like Urza's Saga and Emry, Lurker of the Loch, the deck aims to rapidly deploy threats and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of cards like Engineered Explosives and Metallic Rebuke provides additional flexibility and control elements to help maintain the deck's tempo and pressure on the opponent.

This deck focuses on using ramp effects to quickly cast powerful Eldrazi creatures and control the game with removal spells and disruptive effects. By ramping into Ugin, Eye of the Storms and Emrakul, the Promised End, the deck can quickly take over the game and overwhelm the opponent. Malevolent Rumble and Kozilek's Return provide additional board control, while Sowing Mycospawn and Devourer of Destiny offer ways to protect against aggressive strategies. Overall, the deck aims to establish a dominant board presence and control the game until it can close out the match with its powerful Eldrazi creatures.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. It then utilizes powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer, Ulamog, and Devourer of Destiny to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Karn, the Great Creator also plays a key role in shutting down artifact-based strategies. The deck aims to ramp up quickly and overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats while maintaining control of the game with removal spells and disruption.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The deck aims to establish early board presence with cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, while also utilizing powerful burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to clear the way for creature attacks. The inclusion of cards like The Legend of Roku and Voice of Victory provide additional card advantage and utility. By maintaining a steady stream of threats and removal, this deck aims to pressure the opponent and close out games quickly.

The deck focuses on aggressive creatures like Quantum Riddler, Ragavan, and Phelia, supported by removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Consign to Memory. It also includes disruptive cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Galvanic Discharge to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to quickly apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their strategy with a mix of creatures, removal, and disruptive spells.

The key concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively control the board with low-cost creatures like Cori-Steel Cutter and Monastery Swiftspear, while using spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to remove opposing threats. The deck aims to maintain card advantage and tempo through cards like Expressive Iteration and Mishra's Bauble. Violent Urge and Mutagenic Growth provide additional combat tricks to help push through damage and secure the win. The deck's mana base is constructed to support its aggressive game plan and ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a quick and powerful aggressive strategy. The deck focuses on playing efficient creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, supported by spells like Goblin Bombardment and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah. The overall goal is to pressure the opponent early on and maintain a strong board presence to quickly reduce their life total to zero. The inclusion of cards like Voice of Victory and The Legend of Roku also provide additional ways to finish the game swiftly.

The deck utilizes a variety of control elements such as counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to maintain board control and disrupt the opponent's game plan. It also includes a toolbox style approach with cards like Search for Azcanta and Kaheera, the Orphanguard to provide additional value and flexibility. The deck aims to slow down the game and outvalue the opponent, eventually winning through card advantage and powerful finishers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's color requirements and overall strategy.

The main focus of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy by using discard spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, while also maintaining card advantage with cards like Night's Whisper and Sign in Blood. The deck aims to control the board through removal spells like Consuming Corruption and Dead of Winter, while also generating a significant amount of mana with Cabal Coffers and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth. The win condition revolves around powerful finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Dreams of Steel and Oil, creating a strong resource advantage to overwhelm the opponent.

Mono Black Aggro in Modern focuses on disrupting opponents with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while utilizing efficient removal like Fatal Push and Kozilek's Command to control the board. The deck also uses efficient creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Emperor of Bones to apply pressure and close out the game quickly. Additionally, the inclusion of Urza's Saga provides additional value and card advantage, making it a versatile and powerful deck in a fast-paced 1 vs 1 format.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively overwhelm the opponent with a combination of powerful creatures, efficient removal spells, and burn damage. The deck focuses on deploying threats like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer early on, while also utilizing cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Goblin Bombardment to deal additional damage. The inclusion of cards like Blood Moon and Seasoned Pyromancer helps disrupt opponent's strategies, while cards like Thraben Charm and Voice of Victory provide additional utility and resilience to the deck.
